content: crooked i placed the top of the patch at row 14 the bottom came just above the crotch area page 4 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com beak row instruction stitches **upper beak** using orange 1 chain 2 4 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 4 2 *1 single_crochet 1 increase* around 6 3 *2 single_crochet 1 increase* around 8 4 *3 single_crochet 1 increase* around 10 5 3 single_crochet 1 increase 2 single_crochet 1 increase 3 single_crochet 12 6 3 single_crochet 1 increase 4 single_crochet 1 increase 3 single_crochet 14 bind off leave a long tail so you can sew this to the body later on **lower beak** repeat instructions for upper beak stopping at row 4 bind off 9 and leave a long tail and use it to sew the lower beak to the upper beak weave that tail in then use the tail from the upper beak to sew the combined beak to the face between the eyes flippers make 2 row instruction stitches 1 using orange 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 2 *increase in each single_crochet* around 12 3 4 work even 12 5 *1 single_crochet 1 increase* around 18 6 7 work even 18 8 flatten out flipper so the seam runs along the side where your 9 hook is now crochet through both layers you should have 9 stitches when you reach the end chain 1 t 9 *chain 3 double_crochet decrease 3 stitches together chain 3 slip_stitch in to base of that stitch* repeat two more times making 3 toes bind off leaving a long tail weave the tail down to the other end of the flipper and use that tail to sew the flipper to the legs see if you can stuff the legs a little more page 5 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com wings make 2 in white and 2 in black these are worked flat so chain 1 and turn at the end of each row row instruction stitches 1 chain 2 2 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook 2 2 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet 4 3 increase in 1st single_crochet single_crochet across increase in last single_crochet 6 4 repeat row 3 8 5 decrease over first two single_crochet 5 single_crochet increase in last single_crochet 8 6 increase in 1st single_crochet 5 single_crochet decrease over last two single_crochet 8 7 repeat row 5 8 8 repeat row 5 8 9 work even 8 10 11 decrease over 1st two single_crochet single_crochet across 7 12 repeat row 11 6 13 repeat row 11 5 14 repeat row 11 4 if making a white wing bind off and weave in your end if making a black wing match it up to a white wing and crochet around and through the edges of both wings to connect them together when making the second wing make sure you do
